title: Masked man tries to lure girl, 9, with Jelly Babies outside primary school
text:
Swindon North Police are attempting to trace the main in pink. (Picture Wessex News Agency)

Police are hunting for a man they say attempted to lure a nine-year-old girl to his home from outside a primary school with the offer of a bag of Jelly Babies.

Swindon North Police released an image of the suspect wanted in connection with the terrifying incident.

At around 6pm on Wednesday evening a man wearing a balaclava and neon pink trainers approached the schoolgirl close to Oakhurst Primary School in Deneb Drive, Swindon.

He attempted to encourage the child to return to his home and when the little girl declined he followed her home and made inappropriate comments.

The man is described as white, around 5ft 6in tall, wearing dark tracksuit bottoms and neon pink trainers.

The incident happened outside Oakhurst Primary School in Deneb Drive, Swindon, police said (Picture: Wessex)

Police have said the girl was not injured or physically touched by the man and is now safe.

The force also released CCTV images of a middle-aged man who was spotted ‘acting suspiciously’ in Rodbourne, Swindon, on 5 September.

Officers are exploring possible links between the incidents, they said.

When the man was approached and asked what he was doing he left the area, witnesses said.

Swindon North Police said they are ‘keeping an open mind’ whether this earlier incident is connected to the recent accosting and are hoping to trace the man pictured.
